answerText: Leaf [or leaves][10] Desert plants often use this form of carbon fixation, in which CO2 is collected during the night to form malate, which is then used for photosynthesis during the day.
heading: VCU Closed |2013 | Michigan B and Yale A | 4 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Answer some questions about methods that plants use to adapt to dry conditions, for 10 points each: [10] The spines on a cactus are actually modified versions of this plant part, which in desert plants is often covered by a waxy cuticle. These features of a plant hang from the end of a petiole and are responsible for photosynthesis.
